Class SlaveExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • SlaveExecutor

  • public class SlaveExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    SlaveExecutor is defined by an address identifying where Slave.JAR is located. This location can be a local folder or a folder on a distant machine. "user@c130-25,/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE3" will remotely connect to c130-25 using "user" credentials. "/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE1" will search Slave.JAR on the local computer.
    Author:
    rom

    • Constructor Detail

      • SlaveExecutor

        public SlaveExecutor(java.lang.String address)
        Creates a SlaveExecutor object. A SlaveExecutor is defined by a directory address where the Slave.JAR is locate and optionally a ssh login. "user@c130-25,/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE3" will remotely connect to c130-25 using "user" credentials. "/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE1" will search Slave.JAR on the local computer.
        Parameters:
        address - Directory address where Slave.JAR is located. "[user@hostname,]directory"

    • Method Detail

      • slaveSuccess

        public void slaveSuccess()
        Master can commit a successfully executed Job. This will increase SlaveExecutor priority in round-robin process.

      • getScore

        public float getScore()
        SlaveExecutor score is returned allowing Master to elect the best SlaveExecutor.
        Returns:
        SlaveExecutor score, defined by successNb / (failureNb + successNb)

      • salveFailed

        public void salveFailed()
        Master can commit a failed Job. This will decrease SlaveExecutor priority in round-robin process.

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Master can obtain SlaveExecutor address. Example: "user@c130-25,/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE3" will remotely connect to c130-25 using "user" credentials. "/cal/homes/user/git/SANDBOX/SLAVE1" will search Slave.JAR on the local computer.
        Returns:
        SlaveExecutor address.

      • startJob

        public void startJob(Job job)
        Attach and launch Thread of SlaveExecutor to a Job. The Job must be in state: JobStatus.NOT_STARTED
        Parameters:
        job - A Job object.

      • getJobState

        public java.lang.Thread.State getJobState()
        Return associated thread state.
        Returns:
        A Thread.State : TERMINATED, ...

      • getJob

        public Job getJob()
        Return Job object associate by startJob()
        Returns:
        current Job object.
